narratives.question_text: Please rate and comment on the following aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Workload
comments: Writing concession letters to Equity, or responding to letters from Equity involving complicated labor relations problems - every manager will probably find himself/herself in such situation throughout the tenure. I find the assignments themselves are a helpful tool to organize my thoughts and how to make persuasive points.
It felt like a very reasonable amount of weekly homework.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Organization.Comments:
comments: We moved through the agreement somewhat in order, but weren't able to make it through the whole thing. As far as I know there wasn't a syllabus or a website. There was no mixed media, but I felt the intimate conversations were very productive and effective.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: the Instructor.Comments:
comments: It's hard to rate the instructor because he's more of a conspirator than an educator. It's like he was letting us in on his world and showing us how his brain works. Giving us a lens to see the agreement, but not actually teaching us the agreement.

narratives.question_text: Please comment on: Visitors, if any
Please comment on all aspects of your experience in this course or module regarding: Your Learning.Comments:
comments: Again, this class seems to be all about a lens through which to see agreements with Equity. I'm totally going to expose who I am right now, but being Canadian I had NO idea what incredible differences there were in Equity in Canada and Equity in the States. So I learned a lot about American theatre in this class. Very useful.
More classes? I know he won't do it, but keep asking, haha.
